extendedInfo.description: Meet Fig. Itâs the personal and enjoyable way to pursue your wellness aspirations.Nourish your body and soul with simple activities.Share your journey with friends and loved ones. Flourish together.*Side effects include more happiness, deeper friendships, and additional physical vitality.Features:â Create your own wellness guide by quickly selecting activities from common goalsâ Choose across 6 holistic categories (eat, move, refresh, connect, feel, and go further)â Browse over 300 expert-written activities or customize and create new onesâ Invite friends to form private teamsâ Cheer, rally, and assist each otherâ Track and measure your progressâ Stay connected with a close community that offers tips, suggestions, and supportâ Celebrate and share your successes and milestonesâ Available for Android 4.0 phones and higher, stay tuned for support of other Android versions and devicesNote in regards to permissions:- The Fig app requests permission to user phone book and contacts, in order to allow inviting of friends and loved ones to do wellness together. - You can take a photo in the app to set a personal profile picture (requires camera permissions). - Using push notifications we can inform you about your daily activity progress. Google's push notifications require permissions for: prevent phone from sleeping, read phone status, get accounts, and full network access.

reviews.title: Shouldn\'t restart count on by weekly tasks
reviews.comment: I love the app but it\'s extremely annoying how it clears your task count on your WEEKLY tasks everyday. When I need to do something 5 times a week I don\'t want the counter to go back to 0 everyday. It should stay at the number I\'ve chosen until the start of the next week.
reviews.author: Angela Gifford

reviews.title: False Advertising
reviews.comment: Can only see past 6 days, not 6 months. Editing should use long tap, not double tap.
reviews.author: Nikolay Kolev

reviews.title: Push timed reminders needed
reviews.comment: Push notifications for user timed custom chosen reminder sets could make this a killer app. I feel it would also make the user interactions with the app more natural. This app is meant to remind you of doing certain important things at certain set intervals (which is an excellent idea) but what\'s the point if I keep on forgetting opening the app at each such instance in the correct time?
reviews.author: Abhishek Sengupta

reviews.title: Needs a widget
reviews.comment: Rather than hoping I check the taskbar notifications on time, it would be great to have widget that allowed scrolling of tasks and clicking to add to your counts.  Works as advertised, but having to open and click for each of many tasks that I track is a bit cumbersome and leads to me forgetting to do it. It would also be awesome to have web access to your account (so I can leave the webpage open during the workday and check off items there more conveniently).  Great app, but would be 5/5 with those changes.
reviews.author: Michael Shaffer

reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy S3
reviews.comment: This app is EXACTLY what I have been looking for! Thanks! I will be sure to recommend it!
reviews.author: Les G.

reviews.title: Lacking cultural competence
reviews.comment: The Faith category should be more accurately listed as \"Christian\" as it mentions activities specific to the Christian religion. It has a couple ambiguous ones and none that are specifically for other religions.
reviews.author: Ira Bohm-Sanchez

reviews.title: Unable to sign in or register
reviews.comment: Concept looks good unfortunately unable to use the app
Not compatible with my desire HD :(
reviews.author: Justin Kirkendall

reviews.title: Inspiring
reviews.comment: Keeps me on track in a non-annoying way.
reviews.author: Wesley Jones

reviews.title: Good app!
reviews.comment: Would be better if you could set time and reminders.
reviews.author: Clinton Rogers

reviews.title: Encouraging
reviews.comment: Simple way to stay on track and stay focused on improvements for your life.
reviews.author: Awnry Princess

reviews.title: Almost perfect
reviews.comment: This app would be great if it worked offline... I work in a basement with no cell reception, so it\'s virtually useless throughout the day. Too bad...
reviews.author: Laure Dommel

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: I installed this, but it doesn\'t work. Keeps telling me I have no internet connection when I do, and causes my phone to crash.
reviews.author: Sonja Sweeney

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: I really like it. I wish i could see people with some similar activities & I wish I could undo some.  I accidentally pressed the target 3 times. Still a good self-improvement app!!!! :D
reviews.author: Anna Cornelio

reviews.title: Graphics buggy
reviews.comment: It displays straight lines badly which is pretty annoying,.  It could use a widget for easy reminder and it\'s sad that it resets the counter when goal is achieved (would like long term tracking like a habit tracker). Still it is the best app I tried in the category
reviews.author: Raluca M

reviews.title: Great Potential
reviews.comment: I originally had problems with this app but the developers quickly got to the bottom of it. If they stay active working on it and responding to feedback I think this could be a great app. It would however be great if the settings were more accessible. I understand tjeu want a stripped down interface but it took my a while to find the settings. Keep up the good work.
reviews.author: Paul Kittson

reviews.title: Widget if possible
reviews.comment: A widget for easier tracking would be nice. Love the idea.
reviews.author: Daniel Lim

reviews.title: Slow Response
reviews.comment: After running two updates, the app does not load. It stays locked on the start screen, which doesn\'t help me record my goals.  Also it\'s kind of ironic counting the goal of no electronic before bed if I have run this app before bed...
reviews.author: Benhur Calaguas
